title: Trigonometric Functions - Rewriting and Solving - Part C

content.description:
Directions:

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>f</mn> </math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>x</mn> </math> for which <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadAgacaGGOaGaamiEaiaacMcaaaa@3988@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is a real number. Angle measures for trigonometric functions are assumed to be in radians.

Solutions to equations must be real numbers. Determine the exact value of any expression that can be obtained without a calculator. For example, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mi>log</mi> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mtext> </mtext><mn>8</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C5E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>cos</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mfrac> <mi>π</mi> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CFC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D11@</annotation> </semantics> </math> can be evaluated without a calculator.

Unless otherwise specified, combine terms using algebraic methods and rules for exponents and logarithms, where applicable. For example, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaaikdacaWG4bGaey4kaSIaaG4maiaadIhaaaa@3A9E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mn>5</mn> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>⋅</mo><msup> <mn>5</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BED@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>5</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A32@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>ln</mi><mtext> </mtext><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>ln</mi><mtext> </mtext><mn>5</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F89@</annotation> </semantics> </math> should be rewritten in equivalent forms.

For each part of the question, show the work that leads to your answers.
content.question:
Part C

The function <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>m</mi> </math> is given by

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>m</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@407B@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

Find all input values in the domain of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>m</mi> </math> that yield an output value of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaamaalaaabaGaaGymaaqaaiaaikdaaaaaaa@37D0@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

frqParts.text:
Part C

The function <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>m</mi> </math> is given by

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>m</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@407B@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

Find all input values in the domain of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>m</mi> </math> that yield an output value of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaamaalaaabaGaaGymaaqaaiaaikdaaaaaaa@37D0@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
